definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
blurred vision of an old person (idiom)

sentences.english: The old head lifted; two points of light quivered in the old eyes.
sentences.chinese: 衰老的頭擡了起來，昏花的眼中閃動着兩個光點。

sentences.english: She had bleary red eyes from lack of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她由於缺乏睡眠而雙眼昏花，佈滿血絲。

sentences.english: The old man's hands trembled, his eyesight was blurred, and his step faltered.
sentences.chinese: 老人的雙手驚怖，眼睛昏花，步履也已踉蹌。

sentences.english: Jacob sneaks under the cover of Isaac's blindness and steals away with his father's blessings.
sentences.chinese: 雅各乘以撒老眼昏花，狡猾地騙取了父親的祝福。

sentences.english: But if your eyes are bad, your whole body will be full of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 你的眼睛若昏花，全身就黑暗。

sentences.english: Much knowing has turned my hair grey, and much watching has made my sight dim.
sentences.chinese: 冗雜的知識使我頭髮灰白，紛繁的觀察使我兩眼昏花。

sentences.english: Now Israel's eyes were failing because of old age, and he could hardly see.
sentences.chinese: 以色列年紀老邁，眼睛昏花，不能看見。

sentences.english: But if your eyes are bad, your whole body will full of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 你的眼睛若昏花，全身就黑暗。

sentences.english: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
sentences.chinese: 這些事我們心裏發昏，我們的眼睛昏花。

definition: blurred vision of an old person (idiom)
to stare/to look blank/to be fixed (of eyes)
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
